intro: Phagnalon glabrifolium, commonly known as the smooth-leaved phagnalon, is a flowering plant species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairless, with a distinctive silvery-gray underside. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, contributing to its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
